Abstract: This study explores the integration of machine learning with digital phenotyping to enhance the measurement of psychological health. By leveraging digital biomarkers, we aim to develop predictive models that offer real-time insights into mental well-being. The research focuses on the application of advanced psychometrics to interpret data from digital interactions, providing a nuanced understanding of psychological states. Our findings suggest that machine learning can significantly improve the accuracy and timeliness of psychological assessments, paving the way for personalized mental health interventions and continuous monitoring.
